div.div: The Comal Independent School District is a fast-growing and innovative district with more than 24,900 students in pre-kindergarten through 12th grade. Families are attracted to Comal ISD because of its family values, neighborhood schools and safe environments. Academics, fine arts, athletics and citizenship are emphasized at the 30 campuses located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country.

The district takes great pride in its excellent gifted/talented program, career and technology offerings, dual high school/college enrollment, wide range of special education services, strong emphasis on teacher training, and outstanding fine arts, agricultural and athletic programs.

h3.a: Comal ISD District-wide Vocabulary Jam Set for Friday, April 17

div.div: All students get the chance to test their growing vocabulary skills during a district-wide competition with three separate vocabulary jams scheduled - one each for elementary, middle and high school - Friday, April 17.

h3.a: April Issue of SchooLife Goes Digital

div.div: A digital copy of the April issue of SchooLife is available now. Read about S.P.U.D. week at Canyon High, Water Week at Pieper Ranch, chess champions and more. Plus, check out the advertisers, local businesses and services who constantly step-up to support the district.

h3.a: Comal ISD's Music Program Receives National Recognition

div.div: Comal ISD has been named to the 2020 Best Communities for Music Education list for the first time. Only 87 Texas school districts were named to the list with 754 districts nationwide.

h3.a: Virtual Meetings Scheduled for Spanish Immersion Program

div.div: Parents of current kindergarten students are invited to attend a virtual meeting to learn more about the district's Spanish Immersion Program.

h3.a: Canyon High Students Raise $22,184 During S.P.U.D. Week

div.div: Before "social distancing" became the norm, Canyon High School Student Council members along with various student organizations continued a tradition known as S.P.U.D. week which raises money to help other students in need.
